result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John A. Soung

records.addlTxt: Notice of Hearing - Return to Sender, Moved Left No Address, Unable to Forward

10:01 AM cases 22CM74, 22CM162, 22CM417, 22CM604 called. Prosecuting Attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant John A. Soung not in court, in custody at Eau Claire County Jail.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for John A. Soung. Attorney Rivard requested the defendant not be brought over as he is requests a new return date.
Hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Notice of Hearing - Return to Sender, Moved Left No Address, Unable to Forward

10:08 AM cases 22CM604, 22CM162, 22CM74, 22CM417 called. Prosecuting Attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for John A. Soung. Defendant is currently in custody in Eau Claire County Jail, but Attorney Rivard asked that he not be brought over.
Hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions: 
No contact with J.C. (co-defendant) 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.

(Case called at 11:15 AM) Defendant John Soung appears in person with Attorney Francis Rivard. ADA Matthew Kirkpatrick appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense waives reading of the complaint and updates Defendant's phone number. Court orders Defendant provide finger prints. 
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 08/24/2022 at 1:30 PM. 
Hearing: 09/6/2022 at 9:30 AM.

Conditions: 
No contact with J.C. (co-defendant)
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.
